intro: Lychnophora subulata, commonly known as the slenderleaf lychnophora, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered threatened and is of interest in botanical conservation efforts.
